question: Which of the following tests is used to diagnose benign paroxysmal positional vertigo (BPPV)?
Which of the following organisms most commonly causes acute suppurative otitis media (ASOM)?
Which of the following types of tympanogram is seen in glue ear?
Which of the following investigations is used to differentiate cochlear from retrocochlear hearing loss?

A teenager is brought to the clinic after having hurt himself during a rugby match at school. Examination reveals a fluctuant swelling on his left pinna, where he was hit by the ball. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which test involves applying pressure to the external auditory canal to induce nystagmus?
Which of the following structures is the footplate of stapes attached to?

answers.option: Margin of internal opening to auditory tube
Margin of the aditus to mastoid antrum

question: A 28-year-old swimmer presents to the outpatient department (OPD) with complaints of intense itching, discomfort, impaired hearing, and watery discharge with a musty odor in his right ear. On otoscopic examination, a brown-colored material is noted in his external auditory canal. What will be the appropriate treatment after suction and cleaning?

An 8-year-old boy presents to the outpatient department (OPD) with complaints of severe earache and high-grade fever for the past 3 days. Ear examination reveals inflamed and retracted tympanic membrane with tender postaural swelling. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A young woman comes to the clinic with the complaint of intermittent episodes of vertigo on turning her head to the left. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 24-year-old woman comes to the clinic with complaints of severe vertigo and hearing loss for 4 days. She reports having had a similar attack 1 year ago that resolved without medications. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 37-year-old man presents to the otorhinolaryngology clinic with the complaint of severe pain in his left ear. Examination reveals several vesicles on the tympanic membrane, meatal skin, and concha. What is the diagnosis?

A 9-year-old child is brought to your office with complaints of severe itching and pain in his right ear. Examination reveals a wet newspaper-like mass in the external ear. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A man with a history of chronic suppurative otitis media (CSOM) presents with complaints of severe retro-orbital pain, ear discharge, and diplopia on looking laterally. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 27-year-old man presents to your office with a complaint of discharge from his right ear on and off since his childhood. The discharge is mucoid and profuse in nature. Otoscopy reveals a medium-sized central perforation on the eardrum. What is the most likely diagnosis for this patient?

A 20-year-old male reports to the clinic after a flight with complaints of bilateral severe earache, deafness, and tinnitus. Otoscopy reveals bubbles in the middle ear across a retracted eardrum. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is the most appropriate statement regarding the pyramidal process of the middle ear?

answers.option: It is a projection in the epitympanic recess
It encloses the tensor tympani muscle
It arises from the basal turn of the cochlea
The tendon of stapedius appears from it's summit
It is located in the roof of the middle ear

question: Noise is an undesirable and unwanted vibration of sound that can cause damage to humans both physically and mentally. The intensity of sound is measured in decibels (dB). Which of the following is the daily acceptable limit of noise that the human ear can tolerate without any substantial damage to hearing?
A mother brings in her 4-year-old boy to the clinic with complaints of severe right-sided earache, high-grade fever, and mild hearing impairment. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following investigations is always ordered in cases of chronic suppurative otitis media (CSOM)?

An 8-year-old child is brought to the physician by his parents with complaints of continuous, odorless, and sticky discharge from his left ear. Examination reveals a central perforation of the tympanic membrane. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 25-year-old man presents to the outpatient department with a history of blocked right ear and itching. Otoscopic examination reveals red, sodden, and edematous skin of the external auditory canal filled with a pale blue material. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 28-year-old woman presents to the clinic with complaints of bilateral hearing loss for the past four years and tinnitus. Pure tone audiometry shows a dip in the bone conduction curve at 2000 Hz. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A patient is found to have right ear subtotal perforation. Which of the following findings will be seen on tuning fork tests?

answers.option: False negative Rinne's for left ear

question: A middle-aged woman has developed long-standing purulent secretion in her maxillary sinus. An antral washout is planned. What should be the direction of the trocar and cannula while performing this procedure?

A 55-year-old woman comes to your office with the complaint of vertigo on turning her head to the right and while combing. Past history is relevant for a fall from the stairs around 5 years ago. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 40-year-old male presents to the outpatient department with the complaint of right-sided facial weakness for the past 1 week. He has a history of diabetes mellitus. A diagnosis of Bell's palsy is made. Which of the following is the best tool for the diagnosis of this condition?

A 55-year-old male, who has a history of diabetes mellitus, presents to the clinic with the complaint of severe pain in his left ear for 3 days and foul-smelling purulent discharge. Examination reveals left-sided facial weakness. What is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?
What is the incision on the tympanic membrane called?
Frequency and loudness are two properties of sound. Frequency is measured in hertz (Hz). Which of the following frequency ranges most accurately represents the audible frequency for a human being?

A 24-year-old man presents to the clinic with complaints of severe itching and pain in his right ear. He also complains of pain while opening the mouth. Examination reveals a furuncle located anteriorly on the external auditory canal. Which of the following is the most likely causative organism?

A 3-year-old child is brought to the ENT outpatient department with a history of a deformed ear since birth. Examination reveals an abnormally protruding ear with a large concha and poorly developed antihelix and scapha. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 21-year-old female presents to the otorhinolaryngology outpatient department with the complaint of painless and progressive hearing loss. Her hearing is better in noisy surroundings. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Where will the travelling wave in the basilar membrane reach up to when the frequency of sound is less than 200 Hz?

Noise pollution with sound frequencies ranging from 4000 to 6000 Hz may result in temporary deafness that disappears after some time. Continuous exposure to which intensity of sound may result in permanent deafness?

A 75-year-old lady comes to the clinic with the complaint of decreased hearing bilaterally. Her blood pressure is 145/98 mmHg and her ear examination is unremarkable. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 35-year-old lady presents to the outpatient department 6 months after her surgery with the complaint of recurrence of her ear lesion. In which of the following diseases is recurrence usually seen?
Which of the following structures does the auditory tube run between?

A 4-year-old girl is brought into the clinic by her mother with the complaint of bilateral hearing loss for the last 6 months. She has also been snoring at night. Otoscopy reveals fluid level with air bubbles in both ears along with dull, bluish, and retracted tympanic membranes. What is the most likely diagnosis of this patient?

answers.option: Safe type chronic suppurative otitis media

question: At which part of the cochlea is the frequency 20,000 Hz localized?

A father brings in his 1.5-year-old child to the clinic with the complaint of inability to speak and unresponsiveness to even loud sounds. On investigation, it is found that the child has bilateral profound sensorineural hearing loss. Which of the following treatments is this child the best candidate for?

Tuning fork tests were conducted on a 26-year-old woman. Rinne's test revealed that bone conduction was greater than air conduction in both of her ears. Weber's test was centralized and Schwabach's test was equal to that of the examiner in both ears. Which of the following is the most likely explanation for these findings?
Which of the following functions as the sensory receptor for the transduction of sound waves in the organ of Corti?
A myringotomy is to be performed in an individual with acute suppurative otitis media. Where should the incision be given in the tympanic membrane?

A 19-year-old female presents with pain in her right ear, deafness, tinnitus, and discharge. On examination, a pearly white mass is observed in her ear canal. Upon removing the mass, an ulcer and granulation tissue are found in the widened external auditory canal. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is not a component of the middle ear cleft?

A 50-year-old man is suffering from sudden idiopathic sensorineural hearing loss of moderate degree. He is a known patient of cardiac failure. Which of the following measures is contraindicated for the management of hearing loss in this patient?
"The tympanic membrane shows the prominence of the lateral process of the malleus with loss of light reflex" represents which of the following stages of otitis media?

A 28-year-old female presents to the clinic with a firm and erupted mass at the site she had surgery on for the same lesion 3 months ago. Surgery, pre and post-operative radiation, and local injection of steroids after excision is the preferred modality of treatment in which of the following?

An 80-year-old man presents to the clinic with a complaint of not being able to understand the words properly, although he could hear fine. He has a thirty-year-long history of type 2 diabetes. Otoscopy is normal. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is not a part of the vestibular system?
What is the ideal frequency in Hertz for routine clinical tuning fork tests?
In noise-induced hearing loss, a typical frequency dip occurs at which of the following frequencies?
Which of the following is the primary aim of the surgery in chronic suppurative otitis media?
A 25-year-old female presents to the outpatient department with the complaint of a red, hot, and painful pinna. She is diagnosed with perichondritis. Where is the abscess in perichondritis formed?

answers.option: Between the layers of the skin

question: A 60-year-old man is suffering from a gradual loss of hearing with tinnitus. His audiogram shows a notch at 4 kHz for both air and bone conduction. It is symmetrical on both sides. Which of the following is the cause of his hearing loss?
Which of the following nerves pass through the internal acoustic meatus?
What is the function of earwax?

A 60-year-old female with uncontrolled diabetes mellitus presents to the clinic with severe pain in her left ear. Examination of the ear revealed granulation tissue in the external auditory meatus. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following syndromes presents as a triad of otalgia, facial paralysis and, vesicles around the ear and auditory canal?

A 65-year-old diabetic male presented to the clinic with complaints of foul-smelling ear discharge, greenish-yellow in color. On examination, granulation tissue is seen which bleeds on touch. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 28-year-old woman, 26 weeks pregnant, presents to the outpatient department with complaints of ear pain for 2 weeks and discharge for 2 days. She did not have any convulsions or vomiting and the fever resolved yesterday. Which of the following antibiotics should not be given to this patient?
Which of the following cells are found in the mastoid process?
Which of the following germinal layers forms the tympanic membrane?
Which of the following statements is incorrect regarding the auditory ossicles?

answers.option: The footplate is held in the oval window by annular ligament
The head of the malleus articulates with the body of incus posteriorly
Malleus, incus, and the stapes are the three ossicles
The incus hangs vertically and attaches to the head of the stapes
The ossicles conduct sound energy from the tympanic membrane to the round window

question: A 10-year-old boy presents to the outpatient department for his hearing assessment. Weber test is not lateralized, Rinne test is positive, and the absolute bone conduction (ABC) test is the same as the examiner. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Bone conduction of the patient is compared with that of the examiner in which of the following tests?
What is the most common causative agent of otomycosis?
Which of the following tests helps to distinguish cochlear from retrocochlear hearing loss?

A 7-year-old child presents to the outpatient department with complaints of ear pain and purulent discharge. On examination, the ear lobe is red, hot and movements of the pinna are painful. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following cranial nerves are affected in Gradenigo syndrome?

A 16-year-old presents to the outpatient department with the complaint of left-sided hearing loss and a hard black mass in the tympanic membrane after taking a shower. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following findings are seen in the stage of suppuration of otitis media?

answers.option: Edema and congestion of pars tensa
Mucopurulent blood stained discharge with small perforation in pars tensa
Tympanic membrane retracted and prominent lateral process of malleus
Tympanic membrane bulging to the point of rupture with loss of landmarks

question: Which of the following diseases is associated with cholesteatoma?

answers.option: Atticoantral type chronic suppurative otitis media
Tubotympanic type chronic suppurative otitis media

question: Which of the following is characteristic of acute mastoiditis?

answers.option: Tenderness on applying deep pressure over the mastoid tip

question: A 34-year-old patient presents to the outpatient clinic with complaints of sudden onset vertigo, tinnitus, and fluctuating hearing loss. This attack was preceded by a sensation of fullness in the affected ear. What is the most likely diagnosis?
The endolymph is rich in which of the following ions?
Which of the following is the mainstay of treatment of cholesteatoma?

answers.option: Canal wall up and canal wall down procedures
Aural toilet and control of infection

question: Cholesteatoma has the property to destroy the bone. What method of bone destruction is seen in a patient suffering from cholesteatoma?
Anticoantral type of chronic suppurative otitis media is associated with cholesteatoma. Which of the following type of discharge is present in this type of disease?
Which of the following structures forms the promontory in the middle ear cavity?
What is the normal constituent of the mastoid antrum?

A 25-year-old Caucasian woman comes to the clinic for evaluation of bilateral, conductive, complete deafness, which started as decreased hearing a year ago and got worse during her pregnancy. There is no history of ear discharge, but she complains of ringing in the ears occasionally. Her brother has also suffered from the same problem for 3 years. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is not true regarding the bony labyrinth?

answers.option: It consists of the vestibule, the semicircular canals and the cochlea
Three semicircular canals open into the vestibule by five openings
Bony cochlea winds around pyramid of bone called modiolus
It contains three compartments; scala vestibuli, scala media, and scala tympani

question: A 23-year-old patient with abrupt onset of signs and symptoms of middle ear inflammation and effusion has a history of beta-lactam allergy. Which of the following is the most appropriate choice to treat the infection?

A 56-year-old patient presents to the outpatient clinic with the complaint of facial weakness, dryness of the eye, alteration of taste on the affected side one week after mastoidectomy. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is a complication of mumps infection?
Recruitment phenomenon is seen in which of the following diseases?
Which of the following landmarks will be used to start drilling when performing surgery for mastoiditis?
A 34-year-old female comes to the otorhinolaryngology clinic. She has been diagnosed with otosclerosis. In patients with otosclerosis, what is the dip in the curve of bone conduction called?
Which of the following is the treatment of choice in a patient with otosclerosis?
Which of the following tests is used to diagnose otitis media with effusion?
Cholesteatoma is surgically treated by canal wall-up and canal wall-down procedures. Which of the following two procedures make up the canal wall-down procedure?
Which of the following is not caused by noise-induced hearing loss?
Schwartz sign is an indication of which of the following conditions?
Deflection of the stereocilia away from the kinocilium in the cochlea causes which of the following ion channel changes?
Which of the following parts of the ear is the most affected by Ménière’s disease?
A 20-year-old male had intense pain and itching in his right ear for 5 days. Ear examination revealed wet cheesy material in his right ear. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following organisms is involved in malignant otitis externa?

A 16-year-old boy presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of severe earache with bleeding from his ear. On otoscopy, the tympanic membrane has red, hemorrhagic bullae. There is a history of upper respiratory tract infection. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 16-year-old boy presented with right-side torticollis, a tender swelling behind the ear, and a fever. He has history of ear discharge for the past 6 years. Examination of the ear revealed a purulent discharge with granulations in the middle ear. What is the most probable diagnosis?
Which of the following structures forms the medial wall of the tympanic cavity?
The basilar membrane is present between which of the following two structures?
Which of the following fluids does the membranous labyrinth contains?
The following molecules move from the endolymph into the stereocilia and depolarise the hair cells. Which of the following ions are involved in the depolarisation of stereocilia?
The compartment of the cochlea contains the organ of Corti. Which compartment of the internal ear contains the organ of Corti?
Which nucleus in the medulla receives the nerve fibers from the organ of Corti?
Transmission of auditory signals is performed mainly by inner hair cells rather than outer hair cells of the organ of Corti. Where are the inner hair cells in the organ of Corti present?

A 22-year-old girl with no significant past medical history presents with right-sided ear pain and decreased hearing for 1 month and 1 day of decreased right-sided facial movement when smiling and talking. She was diagnosed as the case of acute otitis media. The physician decided to start framycetin sulfate. Framycetin sulfate belongs to which of the following antibiotics?
Which brainstem structure plays a major role in demonstrating the direction from which the sound originates?

A pus swab for culture and sensitivity is sent for a 28-year-old man who is suffering from atticoantral type of chronic suppurative otitis media (CSOM). What is the most common organism causing this disease?

A 28-year-old male presents to the outpatient clinic with a complaint of an earache for 3 days. On examination, the tragus is markedly tender and the patient refuses to let the doctor do further examination. What is the likely diagnosis?
What will be the most common presentation after sudden exposure to a sound of 160 decibels?
A 20-year-old female presents to the outpatient clinic with complaints of pain, redness, and swelling in her right ear for 5 days. She had her ears pierced a week ago. What is the likely diagnosis?
Which of the following difference cannot be discerned in early noise-induced hearing loss?

A 70-year-old male presents to the outpatient clinic with a complaint of a decrease in hearing for 18 months. He is able to hear better in a quiet room. What is the suitable treatment option for this patient?

answers.option: Modern hearing aid and auditory learning

question: What is the normal threshold of hearing in normally hearing individuals?
Which of the following is a finding seen in patients with otosclerosis on tympanometry?

answers.option: Dip in bone conduction at 4000 Hz

question: What will be the finding in a patient with incomplete perforation of the right tympanic membrane?

answers.option: Weber test lateralized to the poorer side
Positive rinne test in right ear
Weber test lateralized to the better side
Negative rinne test in right ear
Negative rinne test in left ear

question: A 6-year-old child during treatment of a respiratory tract infection develops severe pain in the right ear and conductive hearing loss. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A middle-aged male presents in outpatient with an earache, facial weakness, decreased hearing, and blebs on the ipsilateral external auditory meatus. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A middle-aged male who has a mild upper respiratory tract infection develops severe otalgia during air travel. What is the most likely diagnosis?
What is the common etiological factor of malignant otitis externa?

answers.option: Viral infection of upper respiratory tract

question: What is the most commonly involved organism in malignant otitis externa?
In which of the following conditions tympanic membrane rupture can be seen?

Which one of the following is the most likely disease of the otic bony capsule, characterized by the abnormal removal of mature bone by osteoclasts and replacement by the woven bone of greater thickness?

A 35-year-old female presents to the outpatient clinic with complaints of ear discharge, hearing difficulty, and earache for the past 2 years. On examination, there is a perforation in the tympanic membrane with a pale fleshy mass protruding through the perforation into the external auditory canal. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 45-year-old male presents with an upward deviation of the angle of the mouth on the left side when asked to show teeth after a right-sided mastoidectomy. What is the possible explanation for this complaint?
What is deafness in the old age group people called?
Which of the following best describes Carhart notch?

answers.option: Dip in the bone conduction curve at 400 Hz
Dip in the bone conduction curve at 4000 Hz
Dip in the bone conduction curve at 20000 Hz
Dip in the bone conduction curve at 2000 Hz
Dip in the bone conduction curve at 200 Hz

question: A 30-year-old female presents to the outpatient clinic with a complaint of bilateral decreased hearing for 6 months. She describes that the hearing loss is gradually increasing with time. On examination, the external auditory canal and tympanic membrane are unremarkable. What is the likely diagnosis?
A 28-year-old patient presents with tinnitus and vertigo for 7 days. He has a past medical history significant for multidrug-resistant tuberculosis. What is the provisional diagnosis of this patient?
A 32-year-old female presents with conductive hearing loss for one year. Clinical examination shows a normal and intact tympanic membrane. Which of the following is the most likely possibility?
Which of the following is the simplest test for detecting noise-induced hearing loss?
An 8-year-old boy requires treatment for acute suppurative otitis media with antibiotics. Which of the following antibiotics is not effective for this patient?
What type of tympanogram is seen in a patient with otitis media with effusion?
Which of the following is the maximum safest loudness that a person can be exposed to daily without ear damage according to local guidelines?
A couple with congenital hearing loss is concerned about their newborn child having hearing loss. Which screening test can be done in a newborn child to assess hearing loss?
At which point along the basilar membrane are the highest frequency sounds detected?

answers.option: At a series of widely spaced locations along the membrane
At the midpoint of the membrane
Farthest from the oval window, near the helicotrema

question: A 40-year-old male who works on an airport runway complains of hearing loss. On examination, loss of contraction of the stapedius and tensor tympani muscles is observed. Which of the following pairs of nerves likely supplies these two muscles?

A 20-year-old football player presents to the emergency room after trauma to his pinna. His pinna is swollen with a bluish discoloration. He does not complain of hearing loss. Which of the following is the most appropriate diagnosis?

A 35-year-old female presents to the clinic with the complaint of reduced hearing in both ears. The complaint worsened during pregnancy. Her pure tone audiometry and impedance reports reveal conductive hearing loss with a drop in bone conducting graph at 2000 Hz. Impedance shows As type graph. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A two-year-old boy was brought to the pediatric clinic with the complaint of a small skin-covered tag on a line drawn from the tragus to the angle of the mouth. Cartilage was felt under the skin on palpation. What is the most appropriate diagnosis?

An 8-year-old boy presents to the clinic with complaints of snoring, mouth breathing, and decreased hearing. On examination, bilateral retracted and amber-colored tympanic membranes are observed. What type of graph is likely to be obtained on impedance audiometry?
Which of the following properties of sound is accounted for by the place principle of hearing?
Which of the following statements is the most appropriate regarding the external auditory canal?

A 24-year-old male patient presented to the emergency department with a temporal bone fracture. He has facial nerve palsy. Which of the following temporal bone fractures is most likely to have an associated facial palsy?

answers.option: Hair line fracture with hematoma formation

question: Which of the following ion channels are opened when stereocilia bend towards the kinocilium?
Which of the following contains the auditory cortex?
Which of the following structures is mainly responsible for the transmission of auditory signals?
Which of the following is the most appropriate initial therapy for malignant otitis externa?
Which of the following causes the appearance of Schwartze sign in otosclerosis?
A 56-year-old male presents to the clinic with the complaint of vertigo on turning his head to the left. There is no associated hearing loss or tinnitus. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Otoscopy of a known case of chronic suppurative otitis media reveals invagination of the tympanic membrane. What is the term used to describe this finding?
Which of the following organs is responsible for generating nerve impulses within the ear?

A 7-year-old child with a long history of recurrent ear infections and chronic ear discharge seeks medical attention. The discharge is persistent and has been ongoing for several weeks. Which of the following is the most common organism isolated from chronic discharging ears?

A boy is suffering from acute otitis media. The tympanic membrane is bulging and his symptoms are not improving despite adequate medical treatment. Which of the following is the most appropriate treatment option?

A 40-year-old factory worker presents with a complaint of progressive loss of hearing in both ears for the last three years. His pure tone audiometry is done which reveals sensorineural hearing loss in both ears with a dip in air and bone conduction at 4K. This type of graph is typically seen in which of the following conditions?

A 58-year-old man with a known comorbidity of diabetes mellitus for the past 10 years presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of developing sudden pain in the right ear with a fever. On examination, there is severe inflammation with small red swelling in the external auditory canal. The tympanic membrane is intact. The patient is most likely suffering from which condition?

answers.option: Squamous cell carcinoma of the ear

question: An 8-year-old boy was diagnosed as a case of Bezold abscess. What is the location of pus in this case?

A 23-year-old male patient is diagnosed with a case of otitis media with effusion which is not responding to the medical treatment. Which of the following surgical procedures is required in this case?
A 30-year-old lady who had otosclerosis in both ears got pregnant. What will be the effect of pregnancy on her ear symptoms?

An 18-year-old male patient presents to the emergency department after being slapped by someone on his left ear. On examination, he has perforation in his left ear. Which type of perforation do you expect in this case?

answers.option: Central perforation with irregular margins and tiny clots

question: A 30-year-old female patient came to the clinic after some insect had gone into her right ear, half an hour back. What solution is used to kill or make an insect unconscious before its removal?
How does mumps cause deafness?

answers.option: Otitis media due to viral infection
